document_title: Postpartum hormonal disorders: Causes and signs of recognition
subsection_name: roi-loan-noi-tiet-to-sau-sinh.json_3_How does postpartum hormonal imbalance affect health?
subsection_content:
Hormonal imbalance after giving birth can seriously affect the mother's health.
Many people experience baby blues in the first few days after giving birth, which is a feeling of sadness or fear, and may cry more than usual, get angry, upset, or doubt their ability to care for their baby. This disease will disappear naturally after 1 to 2 weeks. However, if it lasts more than 2 weeks, the mother is likely to suffer from postpartum depression.; The adrenal glands produce hormones, such as steroids and epinephrine (adrenaline), which are involved in a number of possible postpartum symptoms including difficulty sleeping, fatigue, cravings for sweet or salty foods, and taking caffeine as a supplement. replenish energy. These symptoms may also be related to postpartum hormonal fluctuations or depression. (4); Immediately after birth, estrogen and progesterone levels drop, and prolactin, the hormone that helps make breast milk, begins to work. This change often causes the mother's breasts to grow larger than they did during pregnancy due to increased blood and milk flow, creating engorgement. This state reaches its peak 2-3 days after giving birth and the mother's breasts will be quite hard and painful, but will subside within a few days when the mother breastfeeds the baby.; Low estrogen levels can cause vaginal dryness until hormone levels return to normal.; Changes in hormone levels can affect facial skin, causing dry skin, acne or changes in skin pigmentation.; It is normal for the mother to lose hair when the baby is about 3 months old. High hormone levels during pregnancy will cause the mother to grow more hair in 9 months. When hormone levels decrease after giving birth, the mother's hair will decrease and enter a new growth stage.; Changes in hormone levels and blood volume during pregnancy can make you more susceptible to tooth decay and gum disease so don't miss your regular dental checkups.; Slightly blurred vision or dry eyes may be due to pregnancy hormones. If eye problems appear after giving birth while breastfeeding, make an appointment to see an ophthalmologist immediately.
